text: Thank you kraddel & tderoeck! Sampled draft @ VCBF 2017. Hazy paler citrus, little white head. Smells like Fanta Pomello plus white grape, weird but nice. Taste is Fanta Pomello, lime zest, lactose creamy IPA, strange white grape. Oily milkshake IPA body. Weird hop profile but a very refreshing & pleasant one.

On tap at VCBF17, Belgium. 
Nose is citrus. 
Body is non transparent milky yellow, head is small, white, creamy, average lasting, excellent lacing. 
Aroma is tropical fruits, grapefruit, milky, honey, grass. 
Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light citric sour. 
Finish is long lasting citric hoppy medium bitter. 
Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. 
Easy, refreshing, very tasty, well balanced, great one.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2017 Zeer mooi wazig geel bier met creamy schuim. Aroma en smaken van ananas, mango, meloen, beetje perzik. Heel romig van smaak met een lange fruit-bittere afdronk. Galaxy komt goed door. Zeeer lekker !!

47,5cl Can @ The Beer Garden Store, Madrid, Spain.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is hops, citrus, fruits, grain.
Taste is hops, citrus, pineapple, grass.
Medium body, moderate carbonation.

Can. Pours milky yellow, medium white head, dissipates fairly slowly with nice residual and lacing. Aroma is juicy, pine resin, tropical notes, papaya, some dank leaves. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, juicy. Medium body. Pretty tasty beverage.
(Bouteille ou cannette provenant de la brasserie):Juteux, vert, salin et sec pour une buvabilité tout en muscle.

Bottle shared at Ryans January 2017 tasting. Pours a hazy golden body. Nose is mineral and funky hop profile. Mouthfeel is medium to light bodied with notes of hazy funk, spicy citrus fruits and dry mineral character.
Ładna marakuja w aromacie, lekkie, kremowe, mega pijalne, znakomity smak chmielowy i finisz. Goryczka niska. Super!

Can at Ryans, pours a hazy orange gold with medium head. Notes are oranges, skunk cheese, grass, and other dank galaxy notes. Medium to fuller bodied with a bright and juicy finish. Really herbal hopped but still enjoyable.

Lata de @Zombier, Online 22/01/2017 Canned: 09/11/16
Color amarillo, sabor citrico frutal, cuerpo medio , rica.
Aroma y sabor intenso de pomelo, piña y balsámicos. En boca es sabrosa, muy jugosa y extremadamente fácil de beber.

Hazy pale golden color with a white head, good retention and medium lacing. Aroma is light citrusy, intense herbal notes and straw. Flavor with a good bitterness, herbal, grapefruit, light citrus. Milky mouthfeel, good bitterness. This one could be in my 2017 Top 10 Beers...

Draft. Medium white head atop cloudy straw body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some pineapple, straw, light orange, grape. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some pineapple, light grape. Soft light-medium body, light resin.

3/XI/16 - 50cl can from a trade @ 50/50-tasting (50% of the bottles are in the top 50 of their own beer style), ElMananas place - BB: n/a, canned: IX/16/16 (2016-1273) Thanks to dogfish120love for the trade!
Note: first top 50 beer of the tasting. :-)
Cloudy pale bright yellow beer, small irregular white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of citrus, lime juice, some pineapple, some sweaty feet as well. MF: ok carbon, medium to light body. Taste: bit sourish, very fruity, lots of pineapple, grapefruit, some oranges, pretty bitter. Aftertaste: fruity, grapefruit, citrus, pineapple, gentle bitterness, more fruity stuff, soft bitterness, passion fruit. Really liked this one!

Hazy golden-straw colored body, medium sized white head, and soapy lacing. melon, passionfruit, tangerine, grass, and orange rind. clean (almost hidden) malt base. light, fluffy, and juicy. fairly dry with lively bitterness.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 October 2016 - Can share at One Canada Square. Thanks Leighton! As Proclamation Derivative, 6%. Vibrant yellow, almost opaque, foamy white head, dotted lacing. Aroma is condoms, melon and mango. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is floral, dusty, chalky, light oniony rubbery vibes, also apricot and pineapple. I like the dank stuff alongside the fruits. Good. (4.0)
Can thanks to Seth. Pours a hazy yellow with small white head that lasts. The aroma is strong melon, grass, citrus. Medium body, citrus, pine, light bitterness, very good.

16z can. Pours a murky yellow ochre color with a finger or less of white foam. Nose is a mixture of candied orange slices, citrus driven hops and some musty grain. Palate is a bit muddy with earthy clay, wet hay and plenty of citrus notes from the hop additions. A bit astringent and quick on the finish.
Can at home, thanks tderoeck for sharing! Light bitter, very very fruity, citrus, yeasty and grains. Pretty nice!

Pint can. The beer is a hazy pale yellow wigh a white head of foam. Good retention. The aroma has musty oranges, vanilla bean, and pineapple notes. Sweet and fruity taste. Big tropical fruit profile. Medium body and medium carbonation. Soft, velvety mouthfeel. Overall it is pretty good.

pint can shared in CW, many thanks to Leighton. It pours a hazed straw color with a minimal white head. Aroma is fresh grassy danky with notes of straw melon weed and grass. Taste is also danky and bitter astringent with notes of grass, melon, straw, dried leaves and astringent bitter resinous hops. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, good one

Can at level 42, big thanks to LKS. Cheap looking can. It pours cloudy bright gold with a medium white head. The aroma is fresh, juicy, green, grassy, dank, light onion, tropical fruit vibes, pineapple, peach and yellow plum. The taste is fresh, bitter, straw, grassy, green, danky, tropical fruit vibe, pithy lemon, kumquat and some peppery spice with a dry finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Fresh and quaffable. Nice Juan.

Bottle split at Level 42, thanks to Leighton, 20/10/16.
Light yellow orange with a decent off white head.
Nose is dank hop, sticky trops, straw, light bread, pine flicker, toasted malts, apricot.
Taste comprises orange pith, light herbal notes, mango, light pine, straw, mandarin.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with earthy hop bitterness.
Solid APA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: OCT 20, 2016 Bottle shared at the level 42. Canary wharf tasting 20/10/2016.  Huge thanks to Leighton for this one.  . A clouded bright yellow straw coloured pour with a fine white head. Aroma is big dank, grassy citrus, hop, passion fruit, petrol, juicy. Flavour is composed light grains, straw, juicy pineapple, dank citrus, pithy lemon, juicy hop. Palate is medium light, moderate carbonation, grainy, drying finish. Crisp. Solid really sessinable.

Can at Level 42. Big thanks to Leighton for this one. Pours hazy golden with thin head. Aroma is huge pineapple, tropical fruits, almost Lilt. Taste is dank, tropical fruit loveliness with a bit hop finish. Lovely stuff

Can shared in London - big thanks to Sander. Pours cloudy yellow-gold with a frothy, white head. Nice pithy citrus in the nose, rind, a little dank, grapefruit. Light sweet flavour with more pithy grapefruit, lemon rind, light pine netrees does, dry pale malts, faint flinty minerality. Ligh bodied with fine to average carbonation. Clean and dry on th finish, with lingering pith, flint, some lemon peel, grapefruit. Great stuff.
Can thanks to lukasmh. Pours juicy pale yellow with a small white head. Notes of freshly squeezed pineapple juice, citrus, floral, sweet, wheaty.
Pours a very hazy pale yellow with a white lacing. The aroma is citrus, grass, onion and lemon. The palate is dry

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours hazy golden with a one finger head. Aroma of citrus, grapes, grass. Taste is more of the same with a little spice note. Light and refreshing, tons of citrus flavor. Awesome beer.

Tap at at Bukowski Tavern in Cambridge, MA. 12 oz glass...weird mini pint. Looks a little bit like a hefe or witbier. Lighter golden with a healthy white head. Mild aroma with faint lemon and grassy characteristics. Taste follows suit with a very mild quality. Some hops are present but no real bitterness to be found. Very sessionable. Bright and refreshing without bringing all that much flavor to the equation. Lemon keeps coming to mind. Bitter aftertaste. You can probably find better.

Pours hazy gold into a tulip. Bright white head with good retention recedes leaving scant sheets. Marshmallow and tropical fruit aromas. Soft and thin with mango, pineapple and passionfruit upfront turning to tart citrus in the lasting finish. im being kind with soft and thin.. this tasted very good, but was quite flat.

Pours a pale hazy yellow, minimal head. Aroma is peach, grapefruit, mango, grass, orange, bitter citrus rind, pine, light floral hints. Flavor is clean tropical fruits, pineapple, light pine. super light body, playful carbonation... Crushable, fruity, floral, and glorious
Slightly cloudy golden pour with a thin off white head. Aroma of citrus, peach, cereal and clean malt. Easy drinking, dangerous for the ABV!

Lovely hop profile.

Hazy straw pour with little-to-no head,
Flat light body. Lovely hop profile, fruity, complex, light with bittersweet finish yet still manages to be on the drier side.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2015 Bomber from Julios. Pours out a hazy light golden amber. Huge frothy white head. Big aromas of citrus and other fruit. Body is very light and refreshing with layers of citrus, peach, passion fruit with a little spice and bread. Light bitterness, but plenty of flavor. Very nice! Update: 10.20.15 - draft version from growler is equally great!

Fresh bottle, hot off the shelves here in MA. Finally tracked down a god damned beer from this brewery and it did not disappoint. 22 oz bomber drunk 8/13/15.Hazy/murky/cloudy pour as is the wave of the future destined to look. But yet, as always, a massive, thick well-retained white head.Well, Ive definitely realized I dont like Galaxy hops, at all. The nose isnt so problematic with them, though the white peach and ripe apricot gets a bit punchy. In the flavor, however, while the hops arent resinous, theres still a shitload of some compound that, in large quantities present in these type of beers, really gives an aspirin-like flavor and also coats the mouth with a weird capsaicin-like lingering character. 20 minutes after finishing the beer its still here. Anyways, back to the beer, its very, very, very similar to Galaxy Dry Hopped Fort Point. Clean, wonderfully-textured, attenuated, supple malts comfort and balance. Lots of strong hop flavors, quite delicious even in spite of the galaxy hops. Still think Mr. Hill is doing even cleaner, less punchily/messy hopped pales up there, but this is certainly fantastic and only a slight tier below his better/best stuff.

Citrine yellow, hazy and lacy. 
Medium body, assertive flavor, refreshing mouthfeel, high carbonation, avg heat, long palate. 
BitterTartSweet, perfect balance. 
Hoppy, resiny, simple malt. 
Light but delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a growler, fresh from the brewery. More taste than the mosaic, another solid beer. I'd say their best brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
growler thanks to Quag! Boom, tons of light galaxy flavors, mild base, light malty flavors. Just a clean galaxy bomb. Im lovin it.

32oz bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of strong tropical fruits and citrus and floral notes from hops, some pale malts, and some dough. Flavor the same with a very nice hoppiness. Average texture. A solid beer.

They not only can make good sours they are also making some of the best IPAs in Southern New England. Crystal clear straw colored pour from growler into tulip. Aroma is bright citrus fruit explosion with grapefruit, lemon, orange. Taste is clean drinkable light mineral water and galaxy hops everywhere. Mild bitterness.
Bottle thanks to northernbrews. Aromas is floral and tropical fruit hops. Tastes super floral and candied tropical fruit. Moderate sweetness up front with a dry finish. Mild bitterness. Delicious.

Picked up a growler of this from the brewery today. Fresh off the tap. Pours a cloudy light golden color. More on the yellow side. Has a thick white head. Aroma is full of floral hops. Also there is grass, grain, some earthiness, leaves and citrus. Flavor is very straight in your face hops. A little dry. I can taste grass, citrus, pine, and wheat. Leaves a citrusy dry hopped bite. A lot of flavor for 6%.
Pouring at EBF 2015. Pours a hazed gold with a large white head. Big juicy melon on the nose. Green apple and lemon. Medium bodied, spicy hops and melon, musk, citrus, light hops on the finish.
Derivative is an incredibly tasty beer and is the best beer being produced in RI right now!

Sample at EBF. Pours a cloudy yellow with a medium white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is nice and dank but also of tropical fruits. Taste is also fruity, not too bitter but full of hop flavors. Body is medium, carbonation moderately high and it is lightly juicy. Overall a really nice neoIPA, my kind of drink!

sample @ EBF 2015. cloudy if not milky yellow, gold tint, with a frothy white head, good retention and lacing. bright citrus, galaxy explosion - tropical notes, danky melons, pale doughy maltiness - fluffy, lightly honeyed; light carboantion, light to medium body, sharp yet balanced melony-juicy citrus finish. world-class. excellent!

EBF
Pours very hazy blond with medium-high white head. Aroma is of citrus, tropical fruits, pine. Taste is of citrus, tropical fruits, resin, pine, bitterness. Palate: Light body. Medium-high carbonation. Overall: Very good. Refreshing.

Rare 22oz release looks very cloudy even inside the bottle. Pours a light golden with a small with head, looks like grapefruit juice when put to light. Has a strong aroma of sweet fruity smells from the galaxy hops. Nice medium bodied, light carbonation, has a little menthol taste on the dry finish. Easily crushable Pale, bursting with fruity hops, more fruity than bitter. More flavorful than your average Pale and worth a try if you can find it.

Sample @ EBF.

Appearance: Hazy pale yellow-golden with a frothy (and somewhat creamy) persistent white head and good lacing. 

Aroma: Super hoppy, onions/dank, resin, citrus and juicy hops.

Taste: Onions, resin, a good light malt backbone and moderate bitterness. 

Palate: Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Oily and a bit creamy. Dry finish. Dank. Not too sticky.

Overall: Really good juicy pale ale. These guys are impressive all around. Their sours were great and this is a world class pale ale. Easy to drink, super quenching and really tasty.

Sample at EBF. Super pale yellow-greenish pour with thin white head. Great nose, super dank galaxy lemonade, yellow gatorade hops, tropical, juicy and dank, really nice. Light bitterness in the taste, again super fruity, juicy, really enjoyable. Palate is light, dry, good carbonation. I could crush this all day every day.
Draft. Pours yellow white head. Nose/taste of green onion, citrus, cracker malt and tropical fruit. Medium body.
Bottle pour at EBF. Golden orange pour with white head. Very fresh citrus, herbal and grassy hop aromas. Flavors are fresh hops, citrus and grassy tones.
